text:
Part of config:

LoadModule auth_basic_module    modules/mod_auth_basic.so
LoadModule authn_file_module    modules/mod_authn_file.so
LoadModule authz_host_module modules/mod_authz_host.so
(note that mod_authz_groupfile.so is not loaded)

<Location /NEW>
Order Deny,Allow
Deny from all
Allow from xx/29
Allow from xx/29
AuthType Basic
AuthName "Authorization Realm"
AuthUserFile /home/htpass/.htp
Require valid-user
Satisfy Any
</Location>

but server always returns error when accessing that URL:
,,configuration error:  couldn't check access.  No groups file?:  something.php
''

Is group configuration now mandatory?

Loading mod_authz_user.so fixes the problem. The error message is very 
misleading.

 ? "check access.  No groups file?"

etc

My mistake: I was looking in /trunk/

The easiest fix would just be to remove the offending words.  A better fix would
be to tell you the true error (you're using a Require directive that isn't
implemented by any module you have loaded - you'd have got the same if you'd
misspelt a Require).  But that wants thinking about.
